input_text:
Job Title: Full Stack Software Developer - Property and Casualty

Location: Brookfield, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Who We Are

Independent for over 75 years, Milliman delivers market-leading services and solutions to clients worldwide. Today, we are helping companies take on some of the world’s most critical and complex issues, including the development and management of borrower behavior models, risk management, data analytics, capital management and business transformation. Through a team of diverse professionals, we offer unparalleled expertise in insurance consulting, investment consulting, financial services, life insurance and property and casualty insurance.

Milliman invests in skills training and career development, and gives all employees access to a variety of learning and mentoring opportunities. Our growing number of Milliman Employee Resource Groups (ERG’s) are employee-led communities that influence policy decisions, develop future leaders, and amplify the voices of their constituents. We encourage our employees to give back to their varied professions, including leadership in professional organizations. Please visit our web site (https://www.milliman.com/en/social-impact) to learn more about Milliman’s commitments to our people, diversity and inclusion, social impact and sustainability.

Milliman’s Milwaukee-based property and casualty practice is a leading expert in evaluating mortgage risk for government agencies, mortgage lenders, insurers, reinsurers, and investors. Our consulting work is supported by a powerful toolkit of data analytics solutions informed by years of in-depth work in the mortgage industry.

What You Will Do

Milliman M-PIRe™ is a comprehensive suite of software solutions that efficiently evaluates and manages mortgage opportunities, trends in the market, and portfolio aggregation. The Milwaukee-area software development team meets weekly in person at our office in Brookfield, WI to keep the team connected and on track to meet sprint goals.

As a Full-Stack Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining cloud-based web applications across the entire stack, utilizing C#, Azure, and other web technologies. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of front-end MVC development, as well as experience deploying and managing applications in Azure.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and define requirements for software solutions.Design, develop, and maintain scalable and high-performance applications using C#/.NET stack.Implement responsive and user-friendly front-end interfaces using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.Understanding of RESTful APIs and implementation.Deploy, configure, and manage applications on Azure cloud platform.Monitor application performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement optimizations as necessary.Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code following industry best practices and coding standards.Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members.Contribute to the documentation of software architecture, design decisions, and implementation details.

What We Are Looking For

Professional Qualifications (required)

2+ years of professional experience in web app and/or software development using C#/.NET stack, MVC FrameworkProficiency in front-end development technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScriptSolid understanding of relational databases and SQLExperience consuming RESTful APIsFamiliarity with Azure cloud services such as Azure App Service, Azure SQL Database, Azure Functions, etc.Knowledge of software development best practices, design patterns, and principles

Personal Qualifications

Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detailExcellent communication and collaboration skillsCommitted to meeting sprint deadlinesAbility to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing prioritiesEqually comfortable with individual tasks and contributing to the team’s successSeeks out and learns from constructive feedback

Preferred

Familiarity with Fomantic UIKnowledge of DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelinesExperience with source control systems, preferably Azure DevOpsKnowledge of Entity Framework, PowerBI reportsBachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field, or equivalent practical experience

Location

The expected application deadline for this job is June 1, 2024. This role is based out of the Milliman office in Brookfield, Wisconsin. Candidates hired into this role must be willing to work onsite on a weekly basis, with flexible work arrangements.

Benefits

At Milliman, we focus on creating an environment that recognizes – and meets – the personal and professional needs of the individual and their family. We offer competitive benefits which include the following based on plan eligibility:

Medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their dependents, including domestic partnersA 401(k) plan with matching program, and profit sharing contributionEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)A discretionary bonus programPaid Time Off (PTO) starts accruing on the first day of work and can be used for any reason; full-time employees will accrue 15 days of PTO per year, and employees working less than a full-time schedule will accrue PTO at a prorated amount based on hours workedFamily building benefits, including adoption and fertility assistance and paid parental leave up to 12 weeks for employees who have worked for Milliman for at least 12 months and have worked at least 1,250 hours in the preceding 12-month periodA minimum of 8 paid holidaysMilliman covers 100% of the premiums for life insurance, AD&D, and both short-term and long-term disability coverageFlexible spending accounts allow employees to set aside pre-tax dollars to pay for dependent care, transportation, and applicable medical needs

Equal Opportunity 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

Understanding of RESTful APIs and implementation.

They also have a commitment to diversity, inclusion, social impact, and sustainability.
